etymology.description: 謝(謝) (xiè, "to thank") + 謝(謝) (xiè, "to thank") + 你(你) (nǐ, "you")
etymology.interpretation: The phrase 谢谢你(謝謝你) (xièxie nǐ, "thank you") is a polite expression of gratitude towards someone. It is a common way to acknowledge and appreciate assistance or kindness received from another person.

parts.english: to thank; to apologize; to decline; to wither
to thank; to apologize; to decline; to wither

examples.chinese: 我很感激(我很感激)，谢谢你(謝謝你)。
examples.english: I am very grateful, thank you.
